body: This will be fixed in the next minor version release: https://codesandbox.io/s/naughty-sound-yugie?file=/src/App.js

issue.title: Convert form state to use state

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
## üéâ Summary

- convert `useRef` state to `useState`
- export `errors` object inside `formState` and keep `errors` at the root level as an alias
- update unit tests accordingly 
- update cypress automation tests
- convert `validatedFields` & `fieldsWithvalidation` to Object type
- upgrade TS4
- upgrade Cypress 5
- improve Cypress integration tests with state update by @pmaier983 
- minor Type improvement.

## üêû Bugs

- close #2631 reset with useFieldArray
- close fix #2655 disable input

let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

issue.title: defaultValues showing up as undefined on submission when the field is disabled

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I think it might be related to #2655, but slightly different. I am creating a form where I have defaultValues that pre-populate the form, but a field needs to be disabled so the user cannot change it. In the previous version I used (6.3.3), on submission, I used to get the value back, but in the latest version (6.7.0) it is showing up as undefined.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a form with default values
2. disable the input field
3. Click submission
4. The field value is undefined

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
I'm using the same form you linked as an example in one of the help threads.
https://codesandbox.io/s/mystifying-grass-zelzc?file=/src/App.js

If I change the input field to have the disabled prop and click submit, this is what I see
![Screen Shot 2020-08-31 at 10 52 41 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10430283/91739882-26561500-eb78-11ea-8c14-3c29ce307354.png)

**Expected behavior**
I expect the submitted values to have the same value as the defaultValues.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Mac
- Browser Chrome
- Version 6.7.0 (latest)

issue.title: Disabled "Select" values appear in form submit

labels.name: wont be worked on
labels.description: This will not be worked on

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body: **Describe the bug** Similar to https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/2655, but for a Semantic-UI-React Select box. I'd expect that the value is omitted from the onSave data payload, but it is included **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Open sandbox link below 3. Click "Submit" 4. Observe `{"testSelect":"a"}` under the input field **Codesandbox link (Required)** Based on the codesandbox https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/2655 [Codesandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/distracted-leakey-bv8v3?file=/src/App.js) **Expected behavior** I would expect that the output below the submit button does not include an entry for "textSelect **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: OSX - Browser Chrome - Version 84

body:
@bluebill1049 What is the purpose to remove a value from a registered field without unregister it? In fact, to be closer with native forms, a disabled input is always handled when submitting it (and developer have to control it in their submit function). What do you think about?

Thanks and awesome work üòâ

hey @sergiohgz take a look at this tweet: https://twitter.com/bluebill1049/status/1300231640392716288

There is a CSB in there as well, disabled input should be excluded from the final submit.

statckoverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1355728/values-of-disabled-inputs-will-not-be-submitted
I have the same issue, it has not been corrected

issue.title: disabled input returns data to handleSubmit

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I use a Controller with a material ui TextField, which is disabled, but the handleSubmit receives data from this instance, although it should not
I have the same problem as here #2655 

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
https://codesandbox.io/s/interesting-flower-eljie?file=/src/App.js

**Expected behavior**
data from disabled TextInput must not get into handleSubmit

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: macOS
- Browser chrome
- Version [Version 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (x86_64)

body:
> We don‚Äôt support disabled for controller, only native input. Controller host it‚Äôs own value from internal state. There is a feature request u can consider to up vote in the project board.

I'm sure there is a reasonable explanation for this. But from a library user perspective it is not. 

I don't expect `Controller` to make inputs behave fundamentally different than their native counterparts. 

Do you have any workarouand to prevent disabled inputs to be sent when being submitted ?
